title: Why Nerf Aurelian Sol again?
body:
:(

They are reducing the base damage of his w by half at each rank, in exchange for a slight mana cost reduction. I just don't see this as being worth.

Edit: at the time of post, the only thing out were the w nerfs.

Well, meddler addressed this in another thread. His win rate is too high for experienced players. It's almost Azir all over again (not as bad though). 

I can understand why it's being done, it just really feels bad for me and other people who love playing him.

If you check Surrender@20, he's also getting the base damage on his passive buffed to 20-130 from the current 20-97, giving him 155 base damage at level 18 instead of the current 147. This is still technically a nerf to his early game damage, since his passive damage ramps up more slowly when ranking up W, but he's also getting a pretty nice buff to his E, in which he no longer needs to build up Escape Velocity to use the active. It's difficult to gauge the overall impact of these changes, but overall this might be a buff.

because LCS.

Some pro player on CLG or C9 or something mains him.

His winrates IMO have a lot to do with how good his kit is at setting things up.  He has solid forms of engage & disengage paired with the ability to get to wherever the fight is happening very quickly.

His damage is good, but not the thing that's pushing that win rate.

IMO he's fine as is, because those win rates reflect a lot of skill and time with the champion.  If you are looking at champ GG it's also a very small sample size of about 200 - 300 games.  Plus we are in a brusier meta starting to turn away from tanks, and he excels at stopping bruisers who have to chase people.
